title: China Needs to Do More to Stem Fentanyl Crisis, US Diplomat Says
description: The Biden administration called on China to do more to combat the spread of illicit synthetic drugs, weeks after Secretary of State Antony Blinken visited Beijing and pressed leaders to help confront the fentanyl crisis.

title: AI Puzzle: How Do You Catch a Cloud and Pin it Down?
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, national security reporter Anna Edgerton looks at the next phase of the race for AI dominance. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Biden Agrees to Send Cluster Bombs to Ukraine Despite Concerns
description: President Joe Biden has agreed to send cluster munitions to Ukraine, fulfilling a key request from President Volodymyr Zelenskiy despite concerns from arms control groups and human rights activists about the potential harm to civilians.

title: DeSantis’s 2024 Run Brought in $20 Million in Second Quarter, Trailing Trump
description: Ron DeSantis raised more than $20 million during the second quarter, a figure lower than Donald Trump’s haul, but a strong showing given that the Florida governor jumped into the Republican 2024 presidential field in late May.

title: Zelenskiy Makes Diplomatic Tour as Ukraine Seeks a Path to NATO
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy embarked on a diplomatic sweep of NATO capitals ahead of a summit next week as the embattled leader seeks a path into the military alliance.

title: Biden Touts Enphase Energy Investments as ‘Bidenomics in Action’
description: President Joe Biden highlighted a $60 million investment from Enphase Energy Inc. as proof his economic agenda is creating jobs for American workers, taking his “Bidenomics” pitch to South Carolina.

title: African Countries Seek Common Rules for Tapping Carbon Market
description: African governments are trying to devise a common set of rules to govern the fast-growing market for carbon credits as they channel a large share of revenue toward state coffers.

title: Trump Valet in Classified Documents Case Pleads Not Guilty, Hires New Lawyer
description: Donald Trump’s valet and alleged co-conspirator in a plot to withhold classified documents from federal investigators hired a Florida-based attorney before pleading not guilty to the charges on Thursday.

title: Nigeria Suspends Two-Month Old Excise Taxes on Telecom, Tobacco
description: Nigerian President Bola Tinubu suspended excise taxes on telecommunications services and some locally produced goods introduced two months ago.

title: Swedish, Turkish Leaders to Meet in Bid to Break NATO Deadlock
description: Sweden’s prime minister will come face to face with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan on Monday, as Ulf Kristersson is making a last-ditch push to convince Turkey that his nation should be allowed to join NATO.

title: Boris Johnson’s WhatsApp Trove Must Be Released, Court Rules
description: The UK government must comply with an inquiry panel’s demand to disclose all of former Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s WhatsApp messages with his staff during the Covid-19 pandemic, a court ruled in a setback for Rishi Sunak’s administration.

title: UK Sanctions Iran’s Revolutionary Guard Over Kidnap Threats
description: The UK announced sanctions on more than a dozen Iranian individuals and government entities, warning that the administration in Tehran has stepped up efforts to kill or kidnap British or UK-based individuals.

title: Scholz’s Stumbling Coalition Hit With Fresh Blow by Court Rebuke
description: After a bruising few months, Chancellor Olaf Scholz and senior members of his ruling coalition were relaxing at a reception in Berlin’s leafy Tiergarten park when an unprecedented rebuke from Germany’s top court dropped.

title: France’s Fiery Suburbs Get Some Help From Private Equity
description: Ardian SAS, CVC and other investment firms are teaming up to help finance medical research as well as education in impoverished areas of France using the private-equity model for philanthropy as the past week’s riots underscore the desperate state of some Paris suburbs.

title: German Firms’ South African Expansion, 100,000 Jobs Threatened by Visa Mess
description: The gridlock affecting work-permit applications in South Africa is limiting expansion by German companies in the country and threatening operations that support 100,000 jobs, an industry association said.

title: Protests in Israel Turn Violent After Firing of Police Chief
description: Protests in Israel triggered by the firing of Tel Aviv’s police chief spilled into a second day, leading to some of the worst clashes since the peak of this year’s anti-government demonstrations in March.

title: Ramaphosa Marks Passing of Anti-Apartheid Stalwart Essop Pahad
description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa said that anti-apartheid veteran Essop Pahad has died.

title: Finland Plots Retaliation as Russia Orders Consulate Closing
description: Finland is planning to retaliate after Russia on Thursday announced the expulsion of nine diplomats and ordered the closing of Finland’s consulate in St. Petersburg.

title: Warren, Booker Press Bed Bath & Beyond on Worker Severance Pay
description: Senators Elizabeth Warren and Cory Booker are pressing Bed Bath & Beyond Inc. on an earlier move to flout employee severance pay as mass lay-offs roiled the bankrupt retailer’s stores across the country in recent months, according to a letter seen by Bloomberg News.

title: Argentina Opposition Infighting Is Hurting Its Election Chances
description: Argentina’s main opposition coalition is beset by infighting that puts at risk what would otherwise be a landslide election victory for the business-friendly group, according to a top local pollster.

title: UAE Pledges $15 Million to Rebuild Jenin Camp Hard Hit by Israeli Offensive
description: TEL AVIV, Israel (AP) — The United Arab Emirates pledged Thursday to give $15 million to help rebuild the Jenin refugee camp after the most intense Israeli military operation in the occupied West Bank in nearly two decades.

title: Yellen Will Meet With China’s Li in a Push to Ease Tensions
description: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen will meet with Chinese Premier Li Qiang in Beijing Friday, a senior Treasury official said, her first formal engagement in two days of meetings in the Chinese capital.

title: The US and China Are Learning to Fight Nicely
description: The US and China are trying to find better ways to disagree.

title: China Drives Russia Car Sales After Global Brands Quit Over War
description: China is grabbing a bigger share of Russia’s car market, once the third biggest in Europe, after global manufacturers from Volkswagen AG to General Motors Co. pulled out in the wake of President Vladimir Putin’s invasion of Ukraine.

title: After Deadly Derailment, Changes Come Slowly for Canadian City
description: Freight trains still rumble through Lac-Mégantic, Quebec, a daily reminder to its 5,750 residents of the accident that shattered a warm summer night, and their city, 10 years ago.

title: Zelenskiy Visits Bulgaria as Cabinet Boosts Support for Ukraine
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy arrived on a one-day visit to Sofia, Bulgaria’s capital, as the Balkan country’s new government looks to ratchet up its cooperation with Kyiv.

title: Sweden Convicts Militant Kurdish Group Supporter as NATO Talks With Turkey Continue
description: A Swedish court has found a Turkish national guilty of attempted extortion on behalf of the militant Kurdish group PKK, in a case that the leadership of the Nordic country could seek to use in efforts to persuade Turkey to ratify its application for NATO membership.

title: Wagner Chief Prigozhin Is in Russia Now, Lukashenko Says
description: The chief of the Wagner private army that staged an aborted rebellion against the Kremlin’s military leadership last month is currently in Russia, according to Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko.

title: From Banks to BBQ, Brands Targeting Conservatives Fuel a Parallel Economy
description: Maggie Gooding didn’t start her pet foods company to be a conservative counterweight in the industry, she said. She just has a passion for dogs.

title: Clearing Union Dominated by India Moves Toward Rupee Settlements
description: Nine central banks linked to a South Asia-focused clearing house have reached a consensus to settle trade in local currencies, including the Indian rupee, to reduce dependence on the US dollar and the euro.

title: Watchdog Recommends 8-Week Suspension for Pincher, Setting Stage for By-Election
description: A British Member of Parliament whose alleged misconduct helped trigger Boris Johnson’s downfall a year ago, was charged with abuse of power by a parliamentary ethics committee, which recommended an eight-week suspension that is likely to trigger a special election for the seat.

title: Sweden’s NATO Goal Enters Home Stretch as Turkey Upholds Block
description: Sweden is making a last-ditch push to convince Turkey that the Nordic nation should be allowed to join NATO, seeking to end a year-long stalemate that’s stunted the alliance’s northern expansion.

title: Berlusconi’s Oldest Heirs to Control Family Holding Fininvest
description: Silvio Berlusconi’s eldest daughter and son tightened their grip over the family’s business empire, as they were placed in control of the Fininvest SpA holding that controls a range of companies founded by the ex-Italian premier who died last month, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Russian Missiles Hit Western Ukraine as Zelenskiy Vows Response
description: Russia unleashed the most devastating missile barrage to hit the city of Lviv in western Ukraine since the start of the war, prompting the country’s president, Volodymyr Zelenskiy, to vow retaliation for the overnight attack.

title: Ukraine Recap: Deadly Strike on Lviv; Zelenskiy’s Plea to Biden
description: A Russian missile strike on a residential area killed at least four people and injured dozens more in Lviv in far western Ukraine. It was the deadliest hit of the invasion on the city, about 50 kilometers (31 miles) from the Polish border and a key supply route and transportation hub. President Volodymyr Zelenskiy vowed a “strong” response. More than 1000 km to the east, Ukrainian forces continued offensive operations around Bakhmut, General Staff said.

title: China Says 239 People Died From COVID-19 in June
description: BEIJING (AP) — China reported Thursday that 239 people died from COVID-19 in June in a significant uptick months after it lifted most containment measures.

title: Australia Minister Deletes Tweet Calling Trump Jr. a ‘Big Baby’
description: An Australian minister deleted a tweet where she called the son of former US President Donald Trump a “big baby” and a “sore loser” over suggestions his Australia tour had been postponed due to visa delays.

title: China Sees Suicide Rise Among Young Facing School Pressure
description: China has reported an increase in suicides among young people in recent years, prompting researchers to call for a special program to help them deal with academic pressure.

title: Riots in France Expose Decades of Failure in Tinderbox Suburbs
description: Angry and disillusioned youth in the banlieues and an increasingly ill-trained police force have created an explosive situation

title: Justice Department Reveals New Details on Trump Documents Probe
description: Newly unsealed details from the Justice Department’s investigation into Donald Trump’s alleged mishandling of classified information shed light on how investigators made their case in court last year for a warrant to search the former president’s Mar-a-Lago home, including the extent of surveillance footage they said showed boxes being moved.

title: Nevada Settles With Walgreens on Opioid Lawsuit, Bringing Total Settlements to $1.1 Billion
description: LAS VEGAS (AP) — The state of Nevada has reached a $285 million settlement with Walgreens regarding the pharmacy chain's role in the opioid epidemic, the state's top lawyer announced Wednesday.
